children.subject: I believe we are past the drop without a fee deadline so, no.
Ah whoops, I read this message incorrectly.
If we are undecided, can we add the class now and drop later in the spring without fees?

If nothing else, it seems like it should be possible to take the class during the summer and not get units for it until the fall. I believe lab assistants / academic interns were able to do that in past summers. Since the summer GSI application isn't even open, there are very few people who know that they will be involved in a summer class at all. I don't think there's a point in asking everyone who hopes to be a summer TA to join this semester's 375, since it'll crowd the class with a number of students who aren't able to follow along since they don't actually teach. Students get the most out of 375 when they are first time TAs and it seems silly to ask them to take it now.

I agree.

Would there be a way to defer units for students in the summer?

Or to allow students to some how take the 6 units needed for financial aid?

(2 for 375, 1-2 for 399 and 2-3 for a (1)97?, that seems like a bit of work but it's probably better.)

Plus, as a summer instructor I'd hate to be limited to TAs who are able to "afford" to be a TA.

For (EE)CS being a summer TA is usually a significant cost impairment compared to an internship, and I'd hate to further increase that.

(This is compared to during the school year where being a TA has significant financial advantages.)

Dear Students-
Thank you for voicing your concerns about CS 375. We are currently discussing possible solutions to this problem and hope to be in touch soon.  Unfortunately, given the recent news about campus-wide budget cuts we will not be able to absorb the cost associated with paying for CS 375 summer course enrollments.  I will keep you posted as soon as more information is available. 
As always, we appreciate hearing your feedback on these important issues.
Best,
Sarah
Just wanted to follow up with this -- has there been any news about first-time summer TAs being able to defer 375 units until the fall? The add deadline is coming up.
We are close to a solution- will keep you posted as soon as I know more.
Any updates, now that the summer GSI application is out?

Is there a reason the university is charging for 375 over the summer? Last summer the EECS dpt covered it. It seems VERY unfair to force TAs to pay for what is essentially job training. I STRONGLY object to 375 not being subsidized over the summer.

history.content:
Dear Students; 
 
If you are planning to serve as an undergraduate GSI for the first time this summer, I encourage you to enroll in CS 375 for the current (spring 2015) semester.  Students who enroll in CS 375 over the summer will be charged the regular summer session fees (over $600 - $1,000 depending on the number of units) by the University in order to enroll in CS 375 units.  Students who enroll in the spring semester are not charged any additional fees.
Also, if you wish to enroll in CS 375 this spring, please note these two important upcoming deadlines: 
Last day to add without a fee: February 6th
Last day to add without Dean's approval: February 20th
If you have any questions, please contact me.
Best,
Sarah
history.subject: Important update about CS 375
